title: So I played this song to a friend who doesn't watch a lot of animes,

body:
And he said " Sounds like some shietty arse track used in some random dating site", which he then asked me about where the song is from,

After I told him about the source and briefly described the content and the purpose/theme of this particular elegant yet stunning anime to him, he said

"Sounds like something that appeals to no life otakus, giving them the illusion that they might have a chance in life."

I disagree, ladies and gentlemen,

**_I disagree._**

Still though, I cried a bit inside listening to him criticising one of my fav shows like that.

____________

___________

**Here is the serious stuff,**

"Ah! My Goddess!" is imo one of the Best anime out there. Similar to how the entirety of "Aria" is the physical manifestation of relaxation, Ah My Goddess is the artist's personal impression/definition on what "love" actually means to him. 

I disagree with my friend's second comment completely because the entire show started off in a somewhat quick and ridiculous fashion and the story sets in an impossible condition to begin with, being in relationship with an actual god and all. 

Hence we can see the female lead's status of being a god isn't the main goal of this title, but simply a tool to be used to the author's advantage, in order to clearly illustrate his theme about love through a character who is absolutely pure by definition.

To him, **true love does not involve any rituals, traditions**, rules or roles. But instead he strips the idea apart into its very bare minimum in the absolute simplest form of **unconditional tolerance, understanding, mutual-appreciation and care for each other from both parties**. As cheesy as it may sound at first glance, the writer puts his own definition of love through the series in order to both illustrate and test its strength and importance, while simultaneously expressing his utter desires to know and touch this form of completely innocent and untainted form of relationship.

However just like what the author has realised since the very beginning, this kind of love relationship just like man and god, they will never meet in real world. It's a pretty bitter conclusion really, however even with that, he nevertheless completed the story.

I thoroughly deny when someone says this show is a thing to watch for when you need something feel good about yourself. No, this anime is a piece of art, one that is very close if not already, sitting as a masterpiece in my very honest opinion.

Good day to you all folks.

This series has a bit of everything really, it just puts emphasis on the romance aspect of it, and since it's a more mature approach (here I don't mean "real", but "in-depth") on the topic I really don't mind it.

It has some actions, nice amount of comedy, steadily pacing story/plot, no fillers, the conversations are about the right length so you won't get mentally bored hearing about things (although yes the plot can be slow sometimes), not the best but definitely capable visuals (released about a decade ago mind you), interesting and diverse character sets, warming and touching story, and more.

With all that, you already have a recipe for creating a series that is unique, enjoyable and potentially something can truly hold a special place in people's heart.
